comment: I want to start by emphasizing that this professor DOES NOT TEACH. So, if your goal is to actually learn physics or if you plan on taking more physics courses in the future, I wouldn't recommend him. That said, it's an easy A—he drops a lot of grades, and both the midterm and final are pretty manageable.
just don't take this class if you want a A. IMPOSSIBLE CHALLENGE. I GOT COOKED
You fully teach yourself; there is no help at all. He tells you "I am here to help," then makes you feel bad about it, Alo academy is the worst platform to use, it's so confusing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: The smartest professor that I have ever had in my 190+ semester credit hours of education. He purely wants you to learn, not only that but to find pleasure in physics. Frequently responds back and is always willing to help you or understand your situation. Communicating frequently with him will make your time a lot easier.

DON'T TAKE! May be listed as "classroom", but is secretly hybrid/online! He teaches using videos he makes that you watch at home. NO in-class lectures. DOESN'T explain how to solve problems well. BARELY enough time for tests. LOTS of Khan Academy & YouTube was my key to success. DON'T take if you value your social life, sleep & other class grades.
Definitely take him for phys. Lab. The lab was very easy in my opinion.

"flipped" style of teaching. U watch lecture videos at home and class time is spent doing work that counts as bonus pts for the test. He thinks teaching ourselves is the best way to learn which gets very frustrating bc he won't help u much. BUT I would still take him again bc the way he grades makes it easy. (Heavily weighted hw and easy quizes).

Online - Professor was willing to extend the practice test another 24 hours for the class because I asked.  Took in the summer, so there was an assignment, lab, or quiz due almost every day for the 8 weeks. Allows to resubmit test answers for partial credit after each test.  Get a good group for lab - this is 25% of your grade! Overall good teacher
He is really interested in getting you to learn the material. There is plenty of homework. He also gives practice tests and allows you to complete test corrections.

Get all the outside help you can. Not a visualaudio learner? This class will hurt you. There is extra credit, but if you do not solve the problem his way then no credit even when the answer is right. Saw this a couple of times and this kept me from doing any because I'm trying to learn the best way I can, not suck up to some teachers ego.

The class is quizzes (mostly multiple choice can try endless times), homework (which was tricky), labs (pick a good group!), and exams. If you use your resources correctly like a tutor or a good study group you'll be fine. If you're trying to do it alone, good luck!  He is very rude but you could tell he wanted students to get good grades!

Do not go into this class thinking it will be "easier" because it is online. You will put in at least 4-5 hours completing HW, Labs and quizzes each week. Stay on top of your work and don't procrastinate. Spend alot of time on labs as they are weighted the most. Find a solid group to work with and dont tackle this course alone. It is doable.

This teacher is honestly the worst teacher I've ever had IN MY LIFE! DO NOT TAKE HIM! He doesn't teach you anything, I'm taking Physics II next semester and am worried since I've learned nothing this entire semester. His online lecture videos are so long and you don't learn anything, his tests are ridiculous, and he doesn't grade labs fairly

Mzoughi was not helpful whatsoever. Sarcastic and rude when you asked a question in regards to physics concepts. His lecture videos did not help with the chapters we had to learn. Nothing properly structured. Got most of my help from a study group, chegg and another physics professor on campus. AVOID MZOUGHI! Will never take him!

Awesome! WARNING: A LOT OF WORK. A ton of work. He grades mostly on performance. Don't take with too many classes. Almost everything is online, including lectures. People complained a lot about it, but bite the bullet and keep up with it.Do all your work, and you will make good great. Push yourself, and he will notice your efforts. Extra credit!!

Mzoughi is one of the BEST teachers I have ever had! He is so helpful and willing to assist you in any way! The class is not easy! You will have to stay disciplined to watch ALL videos ahead of time and then you will be doing group activities and and in-class lab activity. If you do all required assignments, you will be able to get a good grade!

Teacher is nice but does not prepare the class very well for tests. Is willing to help you but he often times does not make sense. If you're taking physics for the first time sorry hes the only professor that teaches this class. He does not lecture but puts pre recorded lectures online and expects you to self teach yourself. do not recommend
Not too hard. Very time consuming- alot of assignments. He is very nice and helpful. No reason anyone should get less than a B.

Difficult to understand at times, but makes the best effort to get the information you need across. Was not as knowledgeable of the Electronics material as previous courses, but was able to make sure we could understand it in the practical sense. I recommend him.

Very nice, but was a little ill-prepared for the class, because Dr. Stephens (who formerly taught the class) left the school suddenly and Dr. Mzoughi took over it last minute. Tough material; lab was cool. Final replaces lowest grade. Offers extra credit. Grading very fair. I'd take him again!

Mzoughi is a great guy. He does everything he can to help you succeed. There is no final in the class, but you can use that time in the semester to retake one of your other 3 exams. There is a little extra work online such as lecture quizzes and hw, but it only helps in understanding the material.

Extremely nice guy, but very hard class! Gives plenty of chances to bring your grade up and is very helpful. If i wasn't such a moron at math i would have stayed in...but if you need physics, take him!
Mzoughi is one of the best math/science teachers I have ever had, hands down. He will go to great lengths to help you understand the material and is very good at doing it.

Tons of Homework. You need to submit it online, and when its wrong, the question changes until you get it right. You end up getting so caught up in the HW, you dont have time to study.He doesnt even give guidance for the HW. I have always maxed out on credit hours, now I'm taking 10 credit hours and spending twice the time just doing physics work.
Keep track of your grades. He doesn't write anything down then questions your commitment to the class when you do. WOULD NEVER TAKE AGAIN!

Very fair teacher. He's concerned about his students actually learning the material. He gives you tons of opportunities to pass, you have to put some effort into it, but there's no reason anyone should fail if you do the homework and labs. Great teacher!!
Great professor. Very helpful. Many grades besides just tests.

Great teacher.  He is very funny and a very good teacher.  He pulls people to the front to demonstate things often.  He does a lot of examples.  He is very fair on grading.  There are quizes and homework about every week, but it helps your grade.  Tests are fair and he wants you to do well.  Highly recommended.
